object: Processing of Fishery and Aquaculture Products in the Field of Productive Investments - Autonomous Region of Madeira
subject: Name of the notice

object: promote the marketing, quality, and added value of fishery and aquaculture products, as well as the processing of these products
subject: Support to

object: This notice covers actions promoted by companies, as provided for in Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25, relating to
subject: Actions covered by this notice

object: a) Productive investments as well as investments that promote decarbonization, the use of renewable energy and energy efficiency, the circular economy, digitization, and internationalization,
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: b) Investments that promote entrepreneurship by supporting the creation and development of start-ups and spin-offs;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: c) Investments in the certification and promotion of sustainable fisheries and aquaculture products, including the processes leading to the registration of trademarks or patents;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: d) Investments that reduce the impact of the activity on the environment;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: e) Development of marketing and internationalization strategies, including promotional or prospecting and product development actions that are not part of actions organized by producers' associations and organizations;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: f) Marketing innovation, involving the implementation of a new marketing method with significant changes in product design or packaging, or in its promotion and distribution;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: g) Initiatives that promote consumption diversification through the processing of fishery products relating to more abundant species with lower commercial value;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: h) Promotion of short distribution and marketing channels.
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: SMEs whose activity falls within the CAE subclasses provided for in Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25
subject: Entities that can apply

object: a) 10201 “Preparation of fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: b) 10202 “Freezing of fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: c) 10203 “Preservation of fishery and aquaculture products in olive oil and other vegetable oils and other sauces”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: d) 10204 “Salting, drying, and other processing of fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: e) 10411 “Production of crude animal oils and fats, if related to fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: f) 10850 “Manufacture of pre-cooked meals and dishes, if related to fishery and aquaculture products”.
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: in this notice Fund and maximum co-financing rate
subject: Indicative fund allocation available

object: Regional Coordinator of Mar 2030 - Autonomous Region of Madeira
subject: Support management entity/Intermediate body

object: Funds Hotline 800 10 35 10 (9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. - toll-free)
subject: Contacts for further information

object: To promote the marketing, quality, and added value of fishery and aquaculture products, as well as the processing of these products
subject: Aims and objectives

object: 2 - Promote sustainable aquaculture activities and the processing and marketing of fishery and aquaculture products, thereby contributing to the Union's food security
subject: Program Priority

object: FSO2.2 - Promote the marketing, quality, and added value of fishery and aquaculture products, as well as the processing of these products
subject: Specific objectives

object: FSO2.2.02 - Investments in energy efficiency, the circular economy, digitization, and internationalization
subject: Type of intervention

object: 8503 - Investment in reducing energy consumption and energy efficiency
subject: Type of operation

object: 8515 – Investments to support business development (strategy development, administration, equipment)
subject: MAR2030 -2023 -22

object: 8548 – Water consumption and water quality improvement
subject: MAR2030 -2023 -22

object: Is it regulated by public policy or does it contribute to a National Agenda or Strategy?
subject: National legislation

object: The specific objectives pursued are shaped by the Common Fisheries Policy and/or the European Union's Integrated Maritime Policy
subject: National legislation

object: The actions provided for in Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25, are eligible for this notice:
subject: Eligible actions

object: a) Productive investments as well as investments that promote decarbonization, the use of renewable energies and energy efficiency, the circular economy, digitization, and internationalization, including those that:
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: i) Improve environmental and climate performance;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25
Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: iii) Promote the introduction of new species on the market, namely through the valorization of fish with lower commercial value;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: iv) Promote the processing of by-products resulting from the main processing activities;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: v) Promote the valorization of aquaculture products;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: vi) Are innovative, promoted by companies or in co-promotion with universities or research centers, provided they are led by the company;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: vii) Promote the use of renewable energy and improved energy performance, optimization of the use of water resources;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: viii) Promote the use of bio-based, biodegradable, or recyclable packaging, or other initiatives that reduce the use of paper or plastic;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: ix) Contribute to the reduction of food waste through the introduction of innovative solutions in the processing and marketing of fish;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: b) Promotion of entrepreneurship through support for the creation and development of start-ups and spin-offs;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: c) Investments in the certification and promotion of sustainable fisheries and aquaculture products, including the processes leading to the registration of trademarks or patents;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: d) Investments that reduce the impact of the activity on the environment;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: e) Development of marketing and internationalization strategies, including promotional or prospecting and product development actions that are not part of actions organized by producers' associations and organizations;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: f) Marketing innovation, involving the implementation of a new marketing method with significant changes in product design or packaging, or in its promotion and distribution;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: g) Initiatives that promote consumption diversification through the processing of fishery products relating to more abundant species with lower commercial value;
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: h) Promotion of short distribution and marketing channels.
subject: Article 50 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: SMEs whose activity falls within the subclasses of the CAE provided for in paragraph 1 of Article 52 of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25 may be beneficiaries of the support provided for in this notice:
subject: Beneficiary entities (including recipients, where relevant)

object: a) 10201 “Preparation of fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: b) 10202 “Freezing of fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: c) 10203 “Preservation of fishery and aquaculture products in olive oil and other vegetable oils and other sauces”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: d) 10204 “Salting, drying, and other processing of fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: e) 10411 “Production of crude animal oils and fats, if related to fishery and aquaculture products”;
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: f) 10850 “Manufacture of pre-cooked meals and dishes, if related to fishery and aquaculture products”.
subject: Article 52(1) of Ordinance No. 559/2023 of July 25

object: Specific conditions or technical standards to be observed by beneficiaries or operations
subject: MAR2030 -2023 -22

object: With regard to beneficiaries, without prejudice to the eligibility criteria set out in Article 14 of Decree-Law No. 20-A/2023, of March 22, which establishes the general regime for the application of European funds in Portugal 2030 and the general criteria defined in Article 5 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25, the beneficiaries of this notice must also comply with the requirements set out in Article 53 of the same Ordinance.
subject: Specific conditions or technical standards to be observed by beneficiaries or operations

object: a) Hold SME status, based on certification from IAPMEI;
subject: Article 53 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: b) Hold an installation permit, in the case of the construction of new establishments;
subject: Article 53 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: c) Hold an operating license and veterinary control number, in the case of the modernization of existing establishments;
subject: Article 53 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: d) Hold authorization for changes to establishments that require licensing, where applicable;
subject: Article 53 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: e) Present a balanced economic and financial situation.
subject: Article 53 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25

object: For this purpose, a balanced economic and financial situation is considered to exist when the pre-project financial autonomy is equal to or greater than 15%, based on the last financial year closed on the date of submission of the application.
subject: Article 53 of Ordinance No. 559/2023, of July 25
